14#ifndef _RADIX_H
15#define _RADIX_H
16
17#include <inttypes.h>
18
19#include <isc/magic.h>
20#include <isc/types.h>
21#include <isc/mutex.h>
22#include <isc/net.h>
23#include <isc/refcount.h>
24
25#include <string.h>
26
27#define NETADDR_TO_PREFIX_T(na,pt,bits) \
28 do { \
29 const void *p = na; \
30 memset(&(pt), 0, sizeof(pt)); \
31 if (p != NULL) { \
32 (pt).family = (na)->family; \
33 (pt).bitlen = (bits); \
34 if ((pt).family == AF_INET6) { \
35 memmove(&(pt).add.sin6, &(na)->type.in6, \
36 ((bits)+7)/8); \
37 } else \
38 memmove(&(pt).add.sin, &(na)->type.in, \
39 ((bits)+7)/8); \
40 } else { \
41 (pt).family = AF_UNSPEC; \
42 (pt).bitlen = 0; \
43 } \
44 isc_refcount_init(&(pt).refcount, 0); \
45 } while(/*CONSTCOND*/0)
46
47typedef struct isc_prefix {
48 isc_mem_t *mctx;
49 unsigned int family; /* AF_INET | AF_INET6, or AF_UNSPEC for "any" */
50 unsigned int bitlen; /* 0 for "any" */
51 isc_refcount_t refcount;
52 union {
53 struct in_addr sin;
54 struct in6_addr sin6;
55 } add;
56} isc_prefix_t;
57
58typedef void (*isc_radix_destroyfunc_t)(void *);
59typedef void (*isc_radix_processfunc_t)(isc_prefix_t *, void **);
60
61#define isc_prefix_tochar(prefix) ((char *)&(prefix)->add.sin)
62#define isc_prefix_touchar(prefix) ((u_char *)&(prefix)->add.sin)
63
64/*
65 * We need "first match" when we search the radix tree to preserve
66 * compatibility with the existing ACL implementation. Radix trees
67 * naturally lend themselves to "best match". In order to get "first match"
68 * behavior, we keep track of the order in which entries are added to the
69 * tree--and when a search is made, we find all matching entries, and
70 * return the one that was added first.
71 *
72 * An IPv4 prefix and an IPv6 prefix may share a radix tree node if they
73 * have the same length and bit pattern (e.g., 127/8 and 7f::/8). To
74 * disambiguate between them, node_num and data are two-element arrays:
75 *
76 * - node_num[0] and data[0] are used for IPv4 client addresses
77 * - node_num[1] and data[1] are used for IPv6 client addresses
78 *
79 * A prefix of 0/0 (aka "any" or "none"), is always stored as IPv4,
80 * but matches all IPv6 addresses too.
81 */
82
83#define RADIX_V4 0
84#define RADIX_V6 1
85#define RADIX_FAMILIES 2
86
87#define ISC_RADIX_FAMILY(p) (((p)->family == AF_INET6) ? RADIX_V6 : RADIX_V4)
88
89typedef struct isc_radix_node {
90 isc_mem_t *mctx;
91 uint32_t bit; /* bit length of the prefix */
92 isc_prefix_t *prefix; /* who we are in radix tree */
93 struct isc_radix_node *l, *r; /* left and right children */
94 struct isc_radix_node *parent; /* may be used */
95 void *data[RADIX_FAMILIES]; /* pointers to IPv4 and IPV6 data */
96 int node_num[RADIX_FAMILIES]; /* which node this was in the tree,
97 or -1 for glue nodes */
98} isc_radix_node_t;
99
100#define RADIX_TREE_MAGIC ISC_MAGIC('R','d','x','T');
101#define RADIX_TREE_VALID(a) ISC_MAGIC_VALID(a, RADIX_TREE_MAGIC);
102
103typedef struct isc_radix_tree {
104 unsigned int magic;
105 isc_mem_t *mctx;
106 isc_radix_node_t *head;
107 uint32_t maxbits; /* for IP, 32 bit addresses */
108 int num_active_node; /* for debugging purposes */
109 int num_added_node; /* total number of nodes */
110} isc_radix_tree_t;
111
112isc_result_t
113isc_radix_search(isc_radix_tree_t *radix, isc_radix_node_t **target,
114 isc_prefix_t *prefix);
115/*%<
116 * Search 'radix' for the best match to 'prefix'.
117 * Return the node found in '*target'.
118 *
119 * Requires:
120 * \li 'radix' to be valid.
121 * \li 'target' is not NULL and "*target" is NULL.
122 * \li 'prefix' to be valid.
123 *
124 * Returns:
125 * \li ISC_R_NOTFOUND
126 * \li ISC_R_SUCCESS
127 */
128
129isc_result_t
130isc_radix_insert(isc_radix_tree_t *radix, isc_radix_node_t **target,
131 isc_radix_node_t *source, isc_prefix_t *prefix);
132/*%<
133 * Insert 'source' or 'prefix' into the radix tree 'radix'.
134 * Return the node added in 'target'.
135 *
136 * Requires:
137 * \li 'radix' to be valid.
138 * \li 'target' is not NULL and "*target" is NULL.
139 * \li 'prefix' to be valid or 'source' to be non NULL and contain
140 * a valid prefix.
141 *
142 * Returns:
143 * \li ISC_R_NOMEMORY
144 * \li ISC_R_SUCCESS
145 */
146
147void
148isc_radix_remove(isc_radix_tree_t *radix, isc_radix_node_t *node);
149/*%<
150 * Remove the node 'node' from the radix tree 'radix'.
151 *
152 * Requires:
153 * \li 'radix' to be valid.
154 * \li 'node' to be valid.
155 */
156
157isc_result_t
158isc_radix_create(isc_mem_t *mctx, isc_radix_tree_t **target, int maxbits);
159/*%<
160 * Create a radix tree with a maximum depth of 'maxbits';
161 *
162 * Requires:
163 * \li 'mctx' to be valid.
164 * \li 'target' to be non NULL and '*target' to be NULL.
165 * \li 'maxbits' to be less than or equal to RADIX_MAXBITS.
166 *
167 * Returns:
168 * \li ISC_R_NOMEMORY
169 * \li ISC_R_SUCCESS
170 */
171
172void
173isc_radix_destroy(isc_radix_tree_t *radix, isc_radix_destroyfunc_t func);
174/*%<
175 * Destroy a radix tree optionally calling 'func' to clean up node data.
176 *
177 * Requires:
178 * \li 'radix' to be valid.
179 */
180
181void
182isc_radix_process(isc_radix_tree_t *radix, isc_radix_processfunc_t func);
183/*%<
184 * Walk a radix tree calling 'func' to process node data.
185 *
186 * Requires:
187 * \li 'radix' to be valid.
188 * \li 'func' to point to a function.
189 */
190
191#define RADIX_MAXBITS 128
192#define RADIX_NBIT(x) (0x80 >> ((x) & 0x7f))
193#define RADIX_NBYTE(x) ((x) >> 3)
194
195#define RADIX_WALK(Xhead, Xnode) \
196 do { \
197 isc_radix_node_t *Xstack[RADIX_MAXBITS+1]; \
198 isc_radix_node_t **Xsp = Xstack; \
199 isc_radix_node_t *Xrn = (Xhead); \
200 while ((Xnode = Xrn)) { \
201 if (Xnode->prefix)
202
203#define RADIX_WALK_END \
204 if (Xrn->l) { \
205 if (Xrn->r) { \
206 *Xsp++ = Xrn->r; \
207 } \
208 Xrn = Xrn->l; \
209 } else if (Xrn->r) { \
210 Xrn = Xrn->r; \
211 } else if (Xsp != Xstack) { \
212 Xrn = *(--Xsp); \
213 } else { \
214 Xrn = (isc_radix_node_t *) 0; \
215 } \
216 } \
217 } while (/*CONSTCOND*/0)
218
219#endif /* _RADIX_H */
